Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Michael Barnard

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:36 AM Defendant Joshua Michael Barnard appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Joshua Michael Barnard. Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Submit to SCRAM by 4:30 pm day of release. No contact with Officer Gradinjan or their family, or Officer Koltz or their except in a professional capacity. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:04 PM Defendant Joshua Michael Barnard appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody. Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Joshua Michael Barnard. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $8000 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant is on PO hold and not objecting at this time. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
